body_html: Thanks for offering to contribute! This has been long awaited (see #678), but by settling on the distributions API there should be more clarity on how to move forward with this. It seems that, following the new PR, having sample and log_prob for a few distributions (exponential, uniform, categorical, beta) would be the most useful, and the moving onto filling out some more methods.
body_text: Thanks for offering to contribute! This has been long awaited (see #678), but by settling on the distributions API there should be more clarity on how to move forward with this. It seems that, following the new PR, having sample and log_prob for a few distributions (exponential, uniform, categorical, beta) would be the most useful, and the moving onto filling out some more methods.
body: Thanks for offering to contribute! This has been long awaited (see https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/678), but by settling on the distributions API there should be more clarity on how to move forward with this. It seems that, following the new PR, having `sample` and `log_prob` for a few distributions (exponential, uniform, categorical, beta) would be the most useful, and the moving onto filling out some more methods.
